edu.uic.cs.dmtm.apriori

Class Itemset

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uic.cs.dmtm.apriori.Itemset

  • public class Itemset
extends java.lang.Object
    A representation of an Itemset, i.e. a collection of Items. It is internally represented as a TreeSet maintaining the ordering given by ItemComparator based on the Items MIS. The collection is a set so no duplicates are allowed. The insertion policy for duplicates reflects the one followed by a TreeSet. The Itemset carries information about it's SDC, support, support count, and tail count. The class provides means to retreive the minumum and maximum MIS among the Items it contains.
    Author:
    Marco Mele, Massimo Piras

    • Constructor Detail

      • Itemset

        public Itemset(java.lang.Double SDC)
        Constructs a new empty Itemset setting its SDC. The support, support count and tail count are set to 0.
        Parameters:
        sdc - the SDC required.

    • Method Detail

      • addItem

        public void addItem(Item item)
        Adds a new Item to the itemset. Contextually computes the minimum and maximum MIS. Item insertion policies reflects the TreeSet ones.
        Parameters:
        item - A new Item.
        See Also:
        Item}, TreeSet}

      • cannotBeTogether

        public boolean cannotBeTogether(java.util.ArrayList<Itemset> cannotBeTogetherItemsets)
        Tests whether this Itemset contains two Items that can not be together according to the list of rules provided.
        Parameters:
        cannotBeTogetherItemsets - An ArrayList of Itemsets containing each a set of Items that can not be together in the same Itemset.
        Returns:
        true if the Itemset contains two or more Items that cannot be together; false otherwise.

                    throws java.lang.NumberFormatException

        Parameters:
        N -
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - when N is zero or negative.

        public Itemset getTail()
        Returns:
        The tail of this Itemset, i.e. the subset containing all the Items but the first. Returns an empty Itemset if applied to a 1-itemset.

      • isJoinable

        public boolean isJoinable(Itemset other,
                          java.lang.Double SDC)
                   throws DifferentItemsetSizeException
        Defines whether two Itemsets can be joined together. Two Itemsets can be joined if they are of the same size, they contain exactly the same Items up to the one before the last one, different last Item, and the difference between their support is less than, or equal to, the value of SDC.
        Parameters:
        other - Another Itemset of the same size.
        SDC -
        Returns:
        true, if the two Itemsets are joinable, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        DifferentItemsetSizeException - when the Itemsets are of different sizes.
        See Also:
        #join(Itemset)}

      • join

        public Itemset join(Itemset other)
             throws NonJoinableItemsetsException,
                    DifferentItemsetSizeException
        Joins two Itemsets in an higher-level one, if the two itemsets are eligible to be joined according to isJoinable.
        Parameters:
        other - Another Itemset
        Returns:
        A new Itemset joining the two, always respecting the ordering given by the ItemComparator.
        Throws:
        NonJoinableItemsetsException - if the two itemsets are not joinable according to isJoinable.
        DifferentItemsetSizeException - if the two itemsets are not of the same size.
        See Also:
        #Itemset.isJoinable(Itemset, Double), Itemset

      • mustHave

        public boolean mustHave(java.util.ArrayList<Item> mustHaveItems)
        Tests whether this Itemset contains at least one of the Items specified by a set of rules.
        Parameters:
        mustHaveItems - An ArrayList of Items
        Returns:
        true when this Itemset contains at least one of the Items in the mustHaveItems list, false otherwise.

      • prune

        public boolean prune(java.util.TreeSet<Itemset> F)
        Applies the pruning rules to the current itemset and determines whether it should be pruned or not from the frequent itemset. An Itemset shall be pruned if its first two items share the same MIS, and among its (k-1)-subsets containing the first element of this itemset there is at least one that is not frequent -- i.e. is not in the given set of frequent itemsets.
        Parameters:
        F - A TreeSet of frequent k-itemsets.
        Returns:
        true, if this Itemset shall be pruned; false otherwise.

      • setItemset

        public void setItemset(java.util.TreeSet<Item> itemset)
        Overwrites the existing itemset with the one provided.
        Parameters:
        itemset - A TreeSet representation of the itemset.
